# Ski 2025

Here are some suggestion of how we could plan skiing in 2025 if we wanted to go to Niseko, Japan. I assumed a group of 10 and assumed we'll leave on the 17th or 18th of January and come back on the 26th. Prices in £ are at today's exchange rates.

## Ski 2024

For comparison, in 2024 we paid:

- £656 pp for 7 nights catered accomodation
- about £300 pp for flights
- about £300 pp for ski passes
- £115 pp for transfer to and from the airport
- about £60 pp for ski hire

So that's about £1,400 pp + ski lessons + restaurants for the whole trip.  
We left on Sunday the 28th of Jan and came back on Sunday the 4th of Feb.  
The La Plagne ski resort has 225 piste-km.

## Niseko, Japan

Niseko is 2 hrs drive from Sapporo's New Chitose Airport.

The Niseko United resort has [50 piste km](https://www.niseko.ne.jp/en/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/23-24_A3_NU_MAP_EN.jpg). 
Kiroro (1 hr drive, [30 piste km](https://www.kiroro.co.jp/guide_map/)) and Rusutsu (30 min drive, [42 piste km](https://rusutsu.com/en/trail-map/)) resorts are also reachable by car, so in total we could explore 122 piste km.

### Accomodation

We could book [Annupuri Onsen Chalet](https://holidayniseko.com/annupuri-onsen-chalet#propertyAvailabilityAccordion), a self-catered chalet within short drive of the slopes. It would be £495 pp (￥1,006,236) when staying Sunday to Saturday and £412 pp (￥838,530) when staying Monday to Saturday.

### Flights

Sadly, it's expensive and time consuming to go to Hokkaido :(

The most direct way is to round-trip [London and Sapporo Saturday to Saturday](https://www.google.com/travel/flights/booking?___________8BmAEB&tfu=CnRDalJJTTFSMWIzcFhYemRTYURSQllWVllTRkZDUnkwdExTMHRMUzB0ZDJWaWNIVXhNRUZCUVVGQlIyRmtTMnRWUWpacmFYbEJFZ3BLVERVek1IeEtURFF4R2dzSWlmQUdFQUlhQTBkQ1VEZ2NjT3J3Q0E9PRICCAAiAxIBMA) (£1,068 pp). That would give us 5 days on the slopes.

### Stopping in Tokyo

Flights to Tokyo are cheaper than flights to Sapporo. So we could take an additional day off and round-trip [London and Tokyo Friday to Sunday](https://www.google.com/travel/flights/booking?___________wGYAQE&tfu=CnhDalJJVG5GQlptWlpibVpuTlRCQldVUjVWVkZDUnkwdExTMHRMUzB0ZDJaaVltSXhNMEZCUVVGQlIyRmtTalk0UTBjMFdYRkJFZzVMVERnMk1ueExUREV3TVRjak1Sb0xDSjJwQXhBQ0dnTkhRbEE0SEhDbHBRUT0SAggAIgA) (£525 pp).

Then we sleep [two nights in Tokyo](https://www3.apahotel.com/search_result/?econ_hotel_id=691&book-checkin=2025-01-18&book-no-night=2&book-no-room=1&book-no-people=2&book-no-children1=&book-no-children2=&book-no-children3=&book-no-children4=&book-no-children5=&book-no-children6=&book-smoking=1) (£52 pp, ￥22,000 per room) to get an impression of the city.

 And [Monday to Saturday we round-trip Tokyo and Sapporo](https://www.google.com/travel/flights/booking?tfs=CBwQAhpKEgoyMDI1LTAxLTIwIh8KA05SVBIKMjAyNS0wMS0yMBoDQ1RTKgJHSzIDMTAzagwIAxIIL20vMDdkZmtyDQgDEgkvbS8wZ3A1bDYaShIKMjAyNS0wMS0yNSIfCgNDVFMSCjIwMjUtMDEtMjUaA05SVCoCR0syAzEyMGoNCAMSCS9tLzBncDVsNnIMCAMSCC9tLzA3ZGZrQAFIAXABggELCP___________wGYAQE&tfu=CmhDalJJU1RWRU5ucHFNbTlLY0VGQldHSnJhbWRDUnkwdExTMHRMUzB0TFhkbVltaHFOVUZCUVVGQlIyRmtUV3RuUmsxMGJ5MUJFZ1ZIU3pFeU1Cb0tDTUk4RUFJYUEwZENVRGdjY0paTxICCAAiAA) (£78 pp). We should be able to hit the slopes for half the day on the days we fly between Sapporo and Tokyo, giving us 5 days on the slopes. 
 
 Once back in Tokyo, we sleep [at a hotel near Narita airport](https://www.booking.com/hotel/jp/nikko-narita.en-gb.html?aid=303948&label=jp-tokyo-narita-airport-jS5iEoDxBABQyQdeAs7lfQS392709423805%3Apl%3Ata%3Ap1%3Ap2%3Aac%3Aap%3Aneg%3Afi%3Atiaud-2009482408685%3Akwd-123026296%3Alp9045886%3Ali%3Adec%3Adm%3Appccp%3DUmFuZG9tSVYkc2RlIyh9Yf5EcukO1MOGLSSAuId8ToA&sid=dad18a0b9226463a7af4045970e9a59e&all_sr_blocks=23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0;checkin=2025-01-25;checkout=2025-01-26;dest_id=-238493;dest_type=city;dist=0;group_adults=10;group_children=0;hapos=7;highlighted_blocks=23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0;hpos=7;matching_block_id=23561455_240321010_3_2_0;no_rooms=5;req_adults=10;req_children=0;room1=A%2CA;room2=A%2CA;room3=A%2CA;room4=A%2CA;room5=A%2CA;sb_price_type=total;sr_order=popularity;sr_pri_blocks=23561455_240321010_3_2_0__1770000%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0__1770000%2C23561455_240321010_3_2_0__1770000%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0__950000%2C23561438_240321010_0_2_0__950000;srepoch=1721580169;srpvid=d3a17497be210223;type=total;ucfs=1&) (£36 pp) and check in after breakfast the next morning.

### Other Costs

- Ski passes for the Niseko United resort are £51 (¥10,500) per day.  
- Ski or Snowboard gear can be [rented for £36 (¥7,500) per day](https://hanazononiseko.com/en/winter/rental-and-retail/rental-niseko-sports).  
- If we rent a [5-seater](https://cars.booking.) and an [8-seater](https://cars.booking.) we should have enough space for our luggage (£78 pp plus gas for 7 days for both cars). Drivers (I'll volunteer) need to have their license translated before the trip. 
- Gasoline is cheap (~£1 per litre). There are 100 km between Sapporo and Niseko and let's say we drive around another 150 km during the week. So we will might drive 700 km in total. If we assume 10 km per litre, we'd spend £7 pp on gasoline.
- Toll for roads shouldn't be more than £10 pp.
- If we book a self-catered chalet, we'll have to buy food or go to restaurants. Prices for that seem to be comparable to what we'd pay to feed ourselves in London (maybe a bit lower).

### Total Cost

Just an estimate - offers can change, the exchange rate can fluctuate etc.

#### With a short stop in Tokyo (9 days):  
£525 (flight to Tokyo) + £52 (hotel in Tokyo) + 78 (flight to Sapporo) + £412 (accomodation) + £36 (airport hotel) + £306 (ski pass) + £216 (gear) + £95 (cars, gas, tolls)  
= £1,720 pp + ski lessons + food + entertainment in Tokyo

#### Without a short stop in Tokyo (8 days):  
£1,068 (flight to Sapporo) + £495 (accomodation) + £255 (ski pass) + £180 (gear) + £95 (cars, gas, tolls)   
= £2,093 pp + ski lessons + food

### Visas

Those of us with [UK, Portuguese, Hungarian or German passports can enter Japan visa-free for 90 days](https://www.mofa.go.jp/j_info/visit/visa/short/novisa.html). Japanese citizens can come and go as they please of course. The [rules for Chinese citizens](https://www.mofa.go.jp/j_info/visit/visa/topics/china.html) read a bit arcane to me, but it sounds like it should be possible, esp. if you've gone in recent years? At least we'll have to make sure to get flights and hotels confirmed before we go.
